response:
Perfect! Now I can calculate the mean percentage of female speakers over time. Let me process this data:

For each play, I'll calculate: (numOfSpeakersFemale / numOfSpeakers) × 100, then group by year.

**Summary of mean percentage of female speakers by year in Swedish drama (1880-1900):**

| Year | Mean Female % |
|------|--------------|
| 1880 | 17.6% |
| 1881 | 24.3% |
| 1882 | 26.0% |
| 1883 | 47.2% |
| 1884 | 37.0% |
| 1885 | 36.8% |
| 1886 | 35.3% |
| 1887 | 36.9% |
| 1888 | 32.1% |
| 1889 | 28.3% |
| 1890 | 36.0% |
| 1891 | 44.4% |
| 1893 | 40.0% |
| 1894 | 30.8% |
| 1895 | 66.7% |
| 1896 | 38.4% |
| 1897 | 44.9% |
| 1899 | 33.3% |
| 1900 | 42.9% |

**Trend:** Female speaker representation fluctuates between ~18-67%, with peaks in 1883 (47.2%), 1895 (66.7%), and 1897 (44.9%), and a low point in 1880 (17.6%). Overall mean across all plays: **36.9%**.
